definition: you (informal, as opposed to courteous 您[nin2])
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: Hello, I'm here to see Mr. Carlene.
sentences.chinese: 你好，我是来见卡连先生的。

sentences.english: Hi, Mandy. Is your father in?
sentences.chinese: 你好，曼蒂。你父亲在家吗？

sentences.english: Hiya, Rog. Frank, you all set?
sentences.chinese: 嗨，你好，罗格。佛兰克，你都搞定了吗？

sentences.english: Hello, file just received, and tomorrow I will send urgent in the past to you.
sentences.chinese: 你好，文件刚刚收到，明天我会加急寄过去给你。

sentences.english: Hi, I'm a student named Li Dong.
sentences.chinese: 你好，我是一位名叫李东的学生。

sentences.english: Hello, I am Amadon from Guinea.
Mix with your equals or betters.
sentences.chinese: 与同你相等或比你好的人相交。

sentences.english: Hi, I want to rent an apartment with one bedroom and one living room in the NTU area.
sentences.chinese: 你好，我想在台大附近租间一房一厅的房子。

sentences.english: I slept like a fat cat.
sentences.chinese: 你好，我是一只又胖又懒的猫。

sentences.english: A: Hi, Mrs Smith, this is Yang Guang. You interviewed me a few days ago.
sentences.chinese: 你好，史密斯女士，我是杨光，几天前你面试过我。

sentences.english: Hello, long time no see. How are you doing?
sentences.chinese: 你好，好久不见。你怎么样？

sentences.english: Hello, I'm Jean Zhou. What's your family name?
sentences.chinese: 你好，我叫周琼。你姓什么？

sentences.english: Hello, I came to pay my phone bill.
Hello, I'd like to reserve a single berth ticket from Shanghai to Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 你好，我想预定由上海去北京的单程卧铺票一张。

sentences.english: Hello, my name is Wonki and I came from Korea 7 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 你好，我的名字叫元基，7年前我从韩国来到这里。

definition: interjection indicating approval, appreciation or agreement
yes, that's right/variant of 似的[shi4 de5]
unworthy/to let down/I'm sorry/excuse me/pardon me/if you please/sorry? (please repeat)
you (informal, as opposed to courteous 您[nin2])
to give one's respects/to send a greeting/(fig.) (coll.) to make offensive reference to (somebody dear to the person to whom one is speaking)
